results.name: default/mysql-7d757bd9df-s9848
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is repeatedly trying and failing to pull the "mysql:5.6" image.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Try pulling the image manually using `docker pull mysql:5.6`.
5. Check for any network/firewall issues.

results.name: default/wordpress-5fc798fcd9-ldjnp
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "wordpress:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check for rate limits on Docker Hub.
5. Try pulling the image manually with `docker pull wordpress:latest`.

results.name: default/mysql

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/mysql-7d757bd9df-s9848], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the pod mysql-7d757bd9df-s9848 is not ready.  
Solution: 1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`. 2. Inspect pod details using `kubectl describe pod mysql-7d757bd9df-s9848`. 3. Look for readiness probe issues. 4. Fix configuration or resource issues. 5. Restart pod if needed.

results.name: default/wordpress

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-5fc798fcd9-ldjnp], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service doesn't have any ready endpoints because the expected pod is not ready.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod details using `kubectl describe pod wordpress-5fc798fcd9-ldjnp`.
3. Resolve any issues found in the pod events or logs.
4. Ensure the pod is running and ready.
